errors.message: This should be 'permissioned, not permissioned, pending decision'

messages:
To indicate what stage of the planning process the site is at one of the following should be used:

- permissioned
- not permissioned
- pending decision

When part of a site is permissioned, it should be recorded as “permissioned” and you should explain in the ‘Notes’ field why it’s only partly permissioned.

For more information see paragraph 5 of [Schedule 2 of the 2017 Regulations](http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2017/403/schedule/2/made).

Notes.value: Planning permission CR/2016/0972/FUL. Allocated in Policy H2 of the Local Plan as �housing for older people�. Development of this site should therefore specifically meet the needs of older people, either as a residential care home (C2) or as general housing (C3) which is designed to meet the needs of older people to meet the building regulations part M category 3. The broader design and layout of development on this site should also give specific consideration to the requirements of older people.

Notes.value: Identified in the Local Plan Housing Trajectory as a suitable and developable site for residential development. There are a significant number of trees within the site particularly along the frontage and rear. The adjoining woodland is a Site of Nature Conservation Importance (SNCI). The impact of any development on trees within and adjoining the site would need to be considered and this is likely to constrain the site�s capacity. Any development is likely to be limited to the footprint of the existing ambulance station although there may be potential for a three storey building providing there is sufficient clearance to the adjoining tree canopies. The yield of the site would be subject to a formal assessment of trees.

SiteNameAddress.value: "Ambulance Station, Ifield Avenue, West Green, Crawley"

input.MinNetDwellingsComment: Minimum figure of 0 reflects planning permission CR/2016/0972/FUL which is for non housing development rather than Class C3 housing
input.NetDwellingsRangeFromComment: Minimum figure of 0 reflects planning permission CR/2016/0972/FUL which is for non housing development rather than Class C3 housing
input.NetDwellingsRangeToComment: Maximum figure of 55 is based on allocation figure in Local Plan Policy H2 (Key Housing sites) (C3 scenario)
input.NonHousingDevelopment: Demolition of existing buildings and erectoin of a continuing care retirement community (class C") (Amended Plans Received)
input.Notes: Planning permission CR/2016/0972/FUL. Allocated in Policy H2 of the Local Plan as �housing for older people�. Development of this site should therefore specifically meet the needs of older people, either as a residential care home (C2) or as general housing (C3) which is designed to meet the needs of older people to meet the building regulations part M category 3. The broader design and layout of development on this site should also give specific consideration to the requirements of older people.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
input.SiteNameAddress: "44 Goffs Park Road, (formerly Oakhurst Grange), Southgate, Crawley"

input.DevelopmentDescription: Conversion of & alteration to 1st & 2nd floors from ancillary retail (A1) & office (B1) to residential (C3) to provide 18 flats (12 x 1 bed & 6 x 2 bed units) & erection of additional floor to provide 7 flats (2 x 1 bed & 5 x 2 bed units) to give a total of 25 units.
input.MinNetDwellingsComment: Minimum figure of 25 is on the assumption of implementation of approved scheme CR/2015/0694/FUL
input.NonHousingDevelopment: Retention & refurbishment of existing ground floor retail (A1) units
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
input.SiteNameAddress: "7 - 13 The Broadway & 1 - 3 Queens Square, Northgate, Crawley"

input.DevelopmentDescription: Prior approval for change of use of ground floor (part), 1st floor, 2nd floor (part) and 3rd floor from B1 (office) to C3 (residential) for 28 residential flats (10 x studio flats, 17 x 1-bedroom flats and 1 x 2-bedroom flat).
input.MinNetDwellingsComment: Minimum figure of 9 is based on an initial assessment, assuming a policy-compliant scheme and retention of the existing building
input.Notes: Prior approval CR/2017/0479/PA3. Other permissions: CR/2016/0700/PA3 granted 03/11/2016. Also see pending permission CR/2018/0188/FUL.

input.PermissionType: planning permission granted under an order

input.Notes: Planning permission CR/2016/0662/FUL. input.NonHousingDevelopment: Erection of a district energy centre building and associated control room/store, underground pipe work route to provide heating and electricity to the building included within the wider Town Hall redevelopment master plan and other developments within Crawley town centre.k
input.Notes: Hybrid planning application CR/2017/0997/OUT for a replacement of town hall, offices and residential development comprising of 182 units is approved subject to Section 106. A district energy centre to serve this development has already been approved under planning permission CR/2018/0139/FUL. Site is part of 'Land North of the Boulevard', which is allocated in Local Plan Policies EC6 (Development Sites within the Town Centre Boundary) and H2 (Key Housing Sites) as a 'Town Centre Opportunity Site' for residential development and/or main town centre uses.

input.DevelopmentDescription: Erection of 14 new apartments, gym and sauna for residents use, bin and bike stores and alterations to the existing parking spaces.

input.DevelopmentDescription: Outline application (all matters reserved) for demolition of existing office building and integrated railway station building, footbridges and ancillary structures. erection of 308 studio, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom residential apartments and associated parking (C3 use class).
input.MinNetDwellingsComment: Minimum figure of 308 is on the assumption of implementation of approved scheme CR/2016/0294/OUT
input.NonHousingDevelopment: Integrated railway station building, footbridges, and ancillary structures; flexible use retail / coffee shop / business centre (A1 / A3 / B1 use classes); 120 space multi-deck station car park, vehicle drop-off lay-by and associated highway works and public realm enhancements
input.Notes: Allocated as a Town Centre Key Opportunity Site for residential and/or town centre uses in Local Plan Policies EC6 (Development Sites within the Town Centre Boundary) and H2 (Key Housing Sites).

Site previously had outline consent for a 312-unit residential scheme, but this has now expired (CR/2007/0114/OUT).

input.DevelopmentDescription: Demolition of existing building and erection of a new part 3 and part 4 storey building comprising 56 apartments (30 x one bed and 26 x two bed) together with 56 car parking spaces and landscaping (Amended description and amended plans received)
input.MinNetDwellingsComment: Minimum figure of 56 is based on the planning permission CR/2017/0974/FUL.

input.Notes: Identified in the Local Plan Housing Trajectory as a suitable and developable site for residential development. There are a significant number of trees within the site particularly along the frontage and rear. The adjoining woodland is a Site of Nature Conservation Importance (SNCI). The impact of any development on trees within and adjoining the site would need to be considered and this is likely to constrain the site�s capacity. Any development is likely to be limited to the footprint of the existing ambulance station although there may be potential for a three storey building providing there is sufficient clearance to the adjoining tree canopies. The yield of the site would be subject to a formal assessment of trees.
